element.name: The Shaman Class
element.description: Channel the Raw Power of Nature with this new Class for the World’s Greatest Roleplaying Game!

description.p: A wild looking half-orc lumbers through the forest, his arcane tattoos glistening in the light that penetrates the forest canopy. A child from his tribe had reportedly seen a group of goblins cutting down ceremonial trees in their sacred grove. Slicing his hand the half-orc smeared his blood on a the hilt of his heartwood maul. His weapon now pulsed with a deep green energy as he ventured forth to deal with the fools that would dare profane their grove. They would pay for desecrating the resting place of his ancestors.

A hunched over, elderly halfling grips his necklace as he faces down the leader of the hobgoblin war-band. The necklace, made from the finger bones of the previous shamans of his tribe, allows their spirits to take charge of his body. With their aid his life force is enhanced by theirs and he moves with the vigor of youth. Quick as lightning, he strikes at the hobgoblin’s head with his ancient club. As his foe slumps to the ground, he reflects on his time defending his people as their champion. Soon his time would end, and his body would die, but his spirit would join the previous shamans, aiding the next champion of their tribe.

A hunched over elvish woman uses her primal connection to life-magic to conduct an ancient ritual on a stolen lock of hair. Far across town, the village fool comes down with a mysterious illness, and within hours he succumbs to the strange pox. The townsfolk suspect dark magic was at play, but after a few days they bury the fool and move on. The man who had dared to insult the old elf had paid for the transgression with his life.

Shamans are the rare few that learn to open themselves to the natural energy that exists in all living things. Using their connection to this power, they are able to use primal energy to enhance their bodies, place curses on foes, or heal the sick. Shamanistic magic is ancient in its origins, and the teachings of shamans that are passed from one generation to the next trace their beginnings to the dawn of the world. Most Shamans embrace the old ways. They find civilized society uncomfortable, instead preferring to spend time in the wild.

Shamans don’t come to learn their magic by study, but through meditation and introspection they learn to channel the raw power innate in all living things. Their connection to the natural world is intense, and they have little control over the flow of energy once they open themselves up to the primal powers of creation. Many who seek become shamans are overwhelmed and consumed by the life-energies around them, turning into large trees or stone statues vaguely reminiscent of humanoids. But, for the few that survive the initiation rituals, they become conduits able to channel the primal energy of creation to perform powerful and overwhelming feats of magic.

When creating your Shaman consider how you came to be a conduit for the power of nature. Were you chosen from birth to be the champion of your tribe, destined to bear the power that comes with the spiritual support of your ancestors? Did a terrible hag steal you away and raise you in her ways, teaching you the secrets of curses and hex magic? Or did you study under an ancient hermit, learning to manipulate the primal forces present in all things to heal the broken?

Whatever your origin, consider how your relationship to the natural world effects your character. Do you gently beseech the power of nature? Or do you violently wrest control of the primeval creative energies around you?

You can make a Shaman quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Wisdom your highest ability score followed by Constitution. Second choose the hermit background. Third select the shillelagh and vicious mockery cantrips along with the 1st-level spells entangle and heroism.
If your group uses the optional rule on multiclassing in the Player’s Handbook, here’s what you need to know if you choose the savant as one of your classes.
Ability Score Minimum. You must have at least a 13 in Wisdom to take a level in this class, or to take a level in another class if you are already a shaman.
Proficiencies Gained. If shaman isn’t your initial class, you gain proficiency in light armor, simple weapons, and one skill from the shaman skill list.

Spellcasting. If you have both the Spellcasting class feature and the Primal Magic class feature from the shaman class, you can use the spell slots you gain from the Primal Magic feature to cast spells you know or have prepared from classes with the Spellcasting class feature, and you can use the spell slots you gain from the Spellcasting class feature to cast shaman spells you know.
As an shaman, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per shaman level after 1st
Weapons: Simple weapons, blow guns, and nets.
Skills: Choose two from Animal Handling, Arcana, Insight, Medicine, Nature, Performance, or Religion

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a shortbow and 20 arrows or (b) 5 javelins
(a) an explorer’s pack or (b) a priest’s pack
Leather armor and a druidic focus

setters.set: A class that channels the raw power of nature.
If shaman isn’t your initial class, you gain proficiency in light armor, simple weapons, and one skill from the shaman skill list.

description.p: Your connection to the powerful energy of creation allows you to channel primordial power to cast spells.
You can use a Shamanistic Focus as a spellcasting focus for your shaman spells. See Creating a Shamanistic Focus for the rules to create or acquire a Shamanistic Focus.
You know two cantrips of your choice from the shaman spell list. You learn additional shaman cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Shaman table.

The Shaman table shows how many spell slots you have, and the level of these spell slots. All of your spell slots are of the same level. To cast one of your shaman spells of 1st-level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.
For example, when you are 5th level, you have two 3rd-level spell slots. To cast the 1st-level spell cure wounds, you must spend one of those slots, and you cast it as a 3rd-level spell.
description.h5: SPELLS KNOWN OF 1ST LEVEL AND HIGHER
description.p: At 1st level, you know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the shaman spell list, which is detailed below. The Spells Known column of the Shaman table shows when you learn more shaman spells of your choice of 1st level and higher. A spell you choose must be of a level no higher than what’s shown in the table’s Slot Level column for your level. When you reach 6th level, for example, you learn a new shaman spell, which can be 1st, 2nd, or 3rd level.

Whenever you finish a long rest, you can replace one spell you learned from this Spellcasting feature with another spell from the shaman spell list. The new spell must be the same level as the spell you replace.

Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your shaman spells, so you use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a shaman spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

center.p: Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

description.p: You can cast a shaman spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag. The spell does not need to be one of your known shaman spells to be cast as a ritual.

div.p: Shamans channel the unbridled energy of creation to produce their spells, and if they are not careful, they can easily lose control and be overwhelmed. To avoid being consumed by their own magic, shamans channel their spells through a special object known as a Shamanistic Focus.

Each shaman crafts their own personal Shamanistic Focus as part of their training to control the power of nature. A Shamanistic Focus is often crafted out of an item of great personal significance; the bone of a tribal elder, a personalized gift from a loved one, or a piece of wood from their sacred grove. The personal significance of the Focus anchors the shaman to this world and prevents them from being consumed by the overwhelming power of nature.
Due to their personal nature, Shamanistic Foci cannot be purchased. However, if a shaman's Focus is destroyed, they can expend 5 gp and one hour to craft a new Shamanistic Focus.

description.p: Shamans must focus on a powerful aspect of themselves in order avoid being consumed by the power they channel. Depending on what aspect of themselves they focus on, known as their sacred technique, the primal energy they channel grants them certain innate bonuses. At 1st level, select a sacred technique from the options below.

Aggression. Shamans who practice this Sacred Technique use their emotions to seize control of the primal energy they channel. Your fierce spirit grants you advantage on saving throws to resist being charmed or frightened.

Balance. Shamans who practice this Sacred Technique maintain a careful balance between self and the primal energy they channel. Your serene spirit grants you a measure of protection. While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your armor class is equal to 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

Vigor. Shamans who practice this Sacred Technique focus on their physical durability to control the primal energy they channel. The primal energy you channel causes your hit point maximum to increase by 1 and increase by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

Shamans who practice this Sacred Technique use their emotions to seize control of the primal energy they channel. Your fierce spirit grants you advantage on saving throws to resist being charmed or frightened.

sheet.description: You have advantage on saving throws to resist being charmed or frightened.

description.p: Shamans who practice this Sacred Technique maintain a careful balance between self and the primal energy they channel. Your serene spirit grants you a measure of protection. While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your armor class is equal to 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

sheet.description: While you are not wearing any armor or shield, your Armor Class is {{ac:shaman}}.

description.p: Shamans who practice this Sacred Technique focus on their physical durability to control the primal energy they channel. The primal energy you channel causes your hit point maximum to increase by 1 and increase by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.
Starting at 2nd level, you learn to prepare special totems that allow you to tap into specific primeval powers without the risk of overwhelming your body and soul.

You learn two totems of your choice from the list at the end of this class description. When you gain certain shaman levels, you can prepare additional totems, as shown in the totems column of the Shaman Table. When you gain a level in this class, you can change out one of the totems you have prepared for another totem that you meet the level or spirituality prerequisites for.

div.p: The appearance of Totems differs from shaman to shaman, and like the creation of their Shamanistic Focus, Totems are often an expression of a shaman's personality or beliefs.
Some shamans carve intricate wooden figures in the likeness of their spirit animal, some manifest enchanted tattoos across their bodies, and others imbue them in trophies collected from slain foes.
What do your Totems look like? Is it a sacred method passed down to you by tribal elders? Or did you create your own personal method to express your own unique connection with nature?

description.p: Upon reaching 3rd level, you adopt a spirituality. Your spirituality dictates the way you interact with the primal forces of nature and the way you manifest your power. Most shamans learn their spirituality directly from their mentor, tribal elders, or a powerful creature of the natural world. However, some shamans have been known to develop their own spirituality in the absence of a mentor.
Choose one of the following Spiritualities; Curse-Binder, Spirit-Warrior, or Witch-Doctor, each of which is detailed at the end of this class description.

Each spirituality has a list of spells that you learn upon reaching certain shaman levels noted in the spirituality description. Once you learn a Spirituality Spell it does not count against your number of Spells Known. You cannot replace a Spirituality Spell with another shaman spell at the end of a long rest or when you gain a level in this class.
Upon learning a Spirituality Spell, if it is not already, the spell becomes a shaman spell for you.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Starting at 11th level, your spiritual connection with the natural world deepens, and you learn to unleash the raw power of nature in overwhelming fashion. Choose one 6th-level spell from the shaman spell list. You can cast this Primeval Conduit spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

At higher levels, you gain more shaman spells of your choice that can be cast in this way: one 7th-level spell at 13th level, one 8th-level spell at 15th level, and one 9th-level spell at 17th level. You regain all uses of your Primeval Conduit spells when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast your Primeval Conduit spells once each per long rest.

description.p: Upon reaching 20th level, you have gained mastery over the power that once threatened to consume you. You have gained the ability to siphon natural energy directly from the world around you. As an action, you can draw upon the life-essence of the surrounding area to regain one of your expended Primal Magic spell slots.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can regain one expended Primal Magic spell slot.

description.p: You have attuned yourself to the foul side of shamanism. Often learned from hags and other dark spell casters, the way of the Curse-Binder uses dark techniques to twist creatures' own life-essence against them. Their familiarity with dark magic allows Curse-Binders to protect themselves against hexes, blights, and other dark magics they confront.
Curse-Binders are solitary spellcasters who prefer to work from the shadows, meticulously planning their next move.

Starting at 3rd level you can twist the life-essence of a creature, hindering their abilities. As an action on your turn you can choose to inflict one of the following primal curses on a creature you can see within 30 feet. Your primal curses last for 1 minute, or until you are reduced to 0 hit points.

Curse of Apathy. When the effected creature attempts to cast a spell it must make a saving throw using its spellcasting ability. On a failed save the spell the creature was attempting to cast automatically fails.
Curse of Draining. At the end of each of its turns the effected creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save they take 1d4 necrotic damage.
The damage of this curse increases by 1d4 at 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).
Curse of Binding. At the start of each of its turns, the effected creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save their movement speed is reduced to 0 until the start of their next turn.
Upon reaching 11th level you can have up to two Curse Totems active at one time, and at 17th level you can have up to three Curse Totems at one time.

Curse of Lethargy. At the start of each of its turns, the effected creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature has disadvantage on any attack rolls they make until the start of their next turn.
You can only have one primal curse active at a time. Cursing another creature with this ability causes the effects of the first primal curse to immediately end.

sheet.description: You can choose to inflict one of the following primal curses on a creature you can see within 30 feet: Curse of Apathy, Curse of Draining, Curse of Binding, or Curse of Lethargy. Your primal curses last for 1 minute, or until you are reduced to 0 hit points. You can only have one primal curse active at a time.

description.p: Also starting at 3rd level you learn to twist the life-energy of those around you in harmful ways. When a creature that you can see within 60 feet makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the roll.
You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When a creature that you can see within 60 feet makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the roll.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, your practice of ancient dark magic has turned your mind into an imperceptible quagmire. You are immune to the non-damaging effects of divination magic, and you are aware when another creature attempts to target you with a divination spell.
In addition, any Wisdom (Insight) checks made to discern your intentions are made with disadvantage.

sheet.description: You are immune to the non-damaging effects of divination magic, and you are aware when another creature attempts to target you with a divination spell. In addition, any Insight checks made to discern your intentions are made with disadvantage.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, you can ward yourself against specific magical effects. At the end of a long rest choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder damage. You gain resistance to that damage type until the end of your next long rest.
Attacks made with silvered weapons ignore any damage resistances you gain from this ability.

sheet.description: At the end of a long rest choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder damage. You gain resistance to that damage type until the end of your next long rest. Attacks made with silvered weapons ignore any damage resistances you gain from this ability.

description.p: You have reached the pinnacle of foul shamanism, the ability to conjure dark spirits that serve your whims. Starting at 14th level, you can cast create undead as a 6th-level spell, without providing any of the material components or expending a spell slot. Spirits rise out of the ground in the shape of the undead you summon. They are under your control until the end of your next long rest, or they are destroyed.
Once you use this ability you must complete a long rest before you can cast create undead in this way again.

sheet.description: You can cast create undead as a 6th-level spell, without providing any of the material components or expending a spell slot. Spirits rise out of the ground in the shape of the undead you summon. They are under your control until the end of your next long rest, or they are destroyed.

description.p: As a Spirit-Warrior, you allow the spirits of the natural world to flow into you and enhance your physical and mental abilities. They move and fight in tandem with the spirits, gaining abilities that may seem unnatural. Once enhanced, these champions act as protectors of ancient temples, sacred groves, and burial grounds.
With their impressive martial prowess, Spirit-Warriors make stalwart allies and terrible foes. Woe to those who would rouse these ancient protectors to action.
When you adopt this Spirituality at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with medium armor and martial weapons.
Spirit-Warriors are particular about what weapons and armor they use, and will go to great lengths to avoid using weapons and armor forged through the toil of industry.

Starting at 3rd level, you can turn a weapon of your choice into a Primal Weapon by inscribing your weapon special totemic glyphs. At the end of a long rest, choose one of the following totemic glyphs to inscribe on a weapon of your choice.

Glyph of Aggression. While wielding the weapon you can use a bonus action to move up to your movement speed towards an enemy creature that you can see. You must end your movement closer to the enemy creature then when you started your movement.

Glyph of Binding. While wielding the weapon you have advantage on any Strength (Athletics) checks you make to grapple creatures, and you have advantage on any attack rolls you make against creatures grappled by you.

Glyph of Draining. While wielding the weapon, you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) whenever you hit an enemy creature with a melee attack.

div.p: Talk to your Dungeon Master about re-flavoring the weapons and armor in the Player's Handbook to fit the Spirit-Warrior's theme. For example, a breastplate carved from the wood of a Heartwood tree, or a maul with an obsidian head. However, there are no mechanical drawbacks to using normal weapons and armor.

sheet.description: At the end of a long rest, choose one of the following totemic glyphs to inscribe on a weapon of your choice: Glyph of Aggression, Glyph of Binding, or Glyph of Draining.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, your bond with the spiritual world and its denizens allows you to draw upon local spirits for protection. As a bonus action you can grant yourself temporary hit points equal to your shaman level, replacing any temporary hit points you already have.

sheet.description: You can grant yourself {{level:shaman}} temporary hit points, replacing any temporary hit points you already have.

description.p: Your connection to the spirit world grows stronger as you grow closer to death. Starting at 10th level, when your remaining hit points are equal to, or less than, your shaman level (not including temporary hit points), you gain the following abilities:

ul.li: You are resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks.
Your melee weapon attacks deal an extra 2d6 of the weapon's damage type on hit.
As a bonus action you can suffuse your weapon with spiritual power granting yourself advantage on all melee attack rolls you make until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: When your remaining hit points are equal to, or less than, {{level:shaman}} (not including temporary hit points), you gain the following abilities: resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks; your melee weapon attacks deal an extra 2d6 of the weapon's damage type on hit; as a bonus action you can grant yourself advantage on all melee attack rolls you make until the start of your next turn.

description.p: Upon reaching 14th level you can allow the spirits to take full control of your body. As a bonus action on your turn, you enter a possessed state that lasts for one minute, or until you are reduced to 0 hit points. While in this possessed state your movement speed is doubled, and your melee weapon attacks deal an additional 2d6 necrotic damage on hit.
Once you use this ability you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: You enter a possessed state that lasts for one minute, or until you are reduced to 0 hit points. While in this possessed state your movement speed is doubled, and your melee weapon attacks deal an additional 2d6 necrotic damage on hit.

description.p: When all other options for help have been exhausted, nobles and peasants alike will turn to the medicine men of old in their time of need. Those who practice ancient healing ceremonies and traditional herbal remedies are known as Witch-Doctors. Masters of stimulating the life-essence of creatures to induce healing, they are often found wandering the land offering aid to those in need.

Beginning at 3rd level, you learn to manipulate the life-energy in other creatures to stimulate natural healing. As a bonus action, you can touch one creature and heal them. The creature regains hit points equal to 1d10 + your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can touch one creature and it regains 1d10 + {{life-bearer:uses}} hit points.

description.p: Also starting at 3rd level, your ability to enhance your allies increases. At the end of a long rest you can bestow the benefits of one of your prepared totems upon a creature of you touch. Upon bestowing this power upon a creature, you lose any benefits granted by the totem.

You may bestow up to half of your known totems (rounded up) upon other creatures. A creature can only receive the benefits of one totem at a time. The benefits of any totem you bestow upon another creature fade at the end of your next long rest.

sheet.description: At the end of a long rest you can bestow the benefits of one of your prepared totems upon a creature of you touch. Upon bestowing this power upon a creature, you lose any benefits granted by the totem. You may bestow up to half of your known totems (rounded up) upon other creatures. A creature can only receive the benefits of one totem at a time. The benefits of any totem you bestow upon another creature fade at the end of your next long rest.

description.p: Upon reaching 6th level, healing others stimulates your own life-essence. Any time you cast a spell or use an ability that restores hit points to a creature, you regain hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

sheet.description: Any time you cast a spell or use an ability that restores hit points to a creature, you regain {{life-bearer:uses}} hit points.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, your own spirit is enhanced when you grant blessings to your allies. You gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws for each totem you have bestowed upon another creature.

sheet.description: You gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws for each totem you have bestowed upon another creature.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, you have forged a direct connection with the life-essence of the world around you. When you are forced to make a death saving throw at the start of your turn, you can instead spring back to your feet with a surge of healing energy. You immediately regain hit points equal to half your hit point maximum, and then you stand up if you so choose. A number of creatures of your choice equal to your Wisdom modifier (mimimum of 1), that are within 30 feet of you regain hit points equal to 2d10 + your Wisdom modifier.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

div.p: As a Witch-Doctor you have the ability to grant other player characters or NPC's the abilities from shaman totems. When selecting the totems you wish to bestow upon another creature, keep in mind that having the same ability from two sources does not stack.
For example, if you bestow the Totem of the Mountain upon a barbarian with the unarmored defense feature, they must choose one AC calculation to use. They cannot use both.

sheet.description: When you are forced to make a death saving throw at the start of your turn, you can instead spring back to your feet with half your hit point maximum. Up to {{life-bearer:uses}} creatures within 30 feet of you regain hit points equal to 2d10 + {{wisdom:modifier}}.

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th level, Spirit-Warrior Spirituality

You may cast the ’enlarge’ version of the enlarge/reduce spell on yourself, without using a spell slot, a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier. You regain all uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You may cast the ’enlarge’ version of the enlarge/reduce spell on yourself, without using a spell slot.

description.p: You gain proficiency in the Perception skill if you do not already have it, and you have advantage on Perception checks that rely on sight or smell.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency in the Perception skill if you do not already have it, and you have advantage on Perception checks that rely on sight or smell.

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th level
As long as part of your body is touching the ground, you have tremorsense with a radius 30 feet At 9th level the radius of your tremorsense increases to 60 feet.

sheet.description: As long as part of your body is touching the ground, you have tremorsense with a radius 30 feet At 9th level the radius of your tremorsense increases to 60 feet.

You gain blindsight with a radius of 30 feet At 15th level the radius increases to 60 feet.

sheet.description: You have blindsight with a radius of 30 feet.
You have blindsight with a radius of 60 feet.

At the end of a long rest, you can cast death ward on a creature of your choice, without expending a spell slot.

sheet.description: At the end of a long rest, you can cast death ward on a creature of your choice, without expending a spell slot.

When you hit an enemy creature with a melee attack you deal an additional 1d4 of the weapons damage type on hit. This additional damage increases to 1d6 at 11th level, and 1d8 at 16th level.

sheet.description: When you hit an enemy creature with a melee attack you deal an additional 1d{{totem-of-the-earthquake:damage-die}} of the weapons damage type on hit.

description.p: Prerequisite: 9th level, Curse-Binder Spirituality
You have advantage on saving throws to resist spells and other magical effects. Additionally, at 16th level you gain resistance to damage from spells.

sheet.description: You have advantage on saving throws to resist spells and other magical effects.
You have advantage on saving throws to resist spells and other magical effects. You have resistance to damage from spells.

description.p: You gain proficiency in the Stealth skill if you do not already have it, and you have advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in natural environments.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency in the Stealth skill if you do not already have it, and you have advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in natural environments.

description.p: Prerequisite: 7th level
When you take the Attack action on your turn, your first attack has advantage if the target is within 5 feet of a creature friendly to you.

sheet.description: When you take the Attack action on your turn, your first attack has advantage if the target is within 5 feet of a creature friendly to you.

description.p: Prerequisite: 7th level
You gain the Long-Limbed trait. When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach increases by 5 feet.

sheet.description: You gain the Long-Limbed trait. When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach increases by 5 feet.

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th level, Witch-Doctor Spirituality
When you hit an enemy creature with a melee attack, you deal an additional 1d6 radiant damage.
The additional damage increases to 2d6 at 11th level, and 3d6 at 16th level.

sheet.description: When you hit an enemy creature with a melee attack, you deal an additional {{totem-of-light:damage-dice}}d6 radiant damage.

description.p: Prerequisite: Spirit-Warrior Spirituality
While not wearing armor or using a shield your armor class is equal to 12 + your Constitution modifier.
Your base movement speed is increased by 5 feet.
This increases to 10 feet at 5th level, 15 feet at 11th level, and 20 feet at 16th level.

sheet.description: Your base movement speed is increased by {{north-wind:speed-bonus}} feet.

description.p: Prerequisite: 7th level, Curse-Binder Spirituality

Your body, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying, becomes slimy and pliable. You can move through any space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing, and you can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being grappled.

sheet.description: You can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

description.p: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour, and you gain a viscous coating on your skin that gives you advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) and Strength (Athletics) checks to escape being grappled.

sheet.description: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour, and you gain a viscous coating on your skin that gives you advantage on Acrobatics and Athletics checks to escape being grappled.

description.p: You gain resistance to acid and poison damage, and have advantage on saving throws to resist being poisoned.

sheet.description: You gain resistance to acid and poison damage, and have advantage on saving throws to resist being poisoned.

You can breathe both air and water, and you gain a swimming speed equal to your movement speed.

description.p: You manifest wicked claws. Your unarmed attacks deal slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier on hit. If you attack with both hands, the damage becomes 1d8.
Starting at 5th level, your unarmed attacks count as magical for the sake of overcoming resistances.

sheet.description: Your unarmed attacks deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + {{strength:modifier}} on hit, or 1d8 + {{strenghth:modifier}} if you use two hands.

Your unarmed attacks deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + {{strength:modifier}} on hit, or 1d8 + {{strenghth:modifier}} if you use two hands. Your unarmed attacks count as magical for the sake of overcoming resistances.

As a bonus action on your turn you can grant yourself temporary hit points equal to your Shaman level.

sheet.description: You grant yourself {{level:shaman}} temporary hit points.

description.p: Prerequisite: 16th level, Spirit-Warrior Spirituality
You gain a flying speed equal to your movement speed, and as a reaction you can reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to your shaman level.

sheet.description: You gain a flying speed equal to your movement speed, and as a reaction you can reduce any falling damage you take by [level:shaman].

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th level, Spirit-Warrior Spirituality

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the attack action on your turn.

description.p: Prerequisite: 9th level, Spirit-Warrior Spirituality

When you fail a saving throw, you may choose to succeed instead. Once you use this ability you must complete a long rest before you can use it again. Starting at 15th level, you can use this ability twice per long rest.

sheet.description: When you fail a saving throw, you may choose to succeed instead.

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th level

As an action, you can exude noxious gas. Every creature within 15 feet must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they are poisoned until the end of your next turn. On a save, the creature is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

sheet.description: You force every creature within 15 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, they are poisoned until the end of your next turn. On a save, the creature is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

description.p: Prerequisite: Curse-Binder Spirituality
You gain Superior Darkvision to a range of 120 feet. You can see in dim light as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light.

sheet.description: You gain Superior Darkvision to a range of 120 feet. You can see in dim light as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light.

description.p: When you score a critical hit with a weapon attack you may can your reaction to immediately make one additional weapon attack targeting the same creature.

sheet.description: When you score a critical hit with a weapon attack you may can your reaction to immediately make one additional weapon attack targeting the same creature.

description.p: When an enemy creature hits you with a critical hit, you can use your reaction to change it into a regular hit. You can use this ability once, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.
Starting at 12th level, you can use this ability twice before you need to complete a short or long rest.

sheet.description: When an enemy creature hits you with a critical hit, you can change it into a regular hit.

description.p: Prerequisite: Curse-Binder Spirituality
When you deal damage to a creature, you can force them to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature cannot regain hit points until the beginning of your next turn.

sheet.description: When you deal damage to a creature, you can force them to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature cannot regain hit points until the beginning of your next turn.

description.p: Prerequisite: 5th level

You can cast the plant growth spell once per day, without expending a spell slot. If you do not cast the immediate version of this spell, the 8 hour version of the spell takes effect on the land around you while you long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast the plant growth spell once per day, without expending a spell slot. If you do not cast the immediate version of this spell, the 8 hour version of the spell takes effect on the land around you while you long rest.

You can cast animate dead once using a shaman spell slot. You can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast animate dead once using a shaman spell slot.

Whenever you finish a short or long rest, you automatically cast goodberry without expending a spell slot or material components.

sheet.description: Whenever you finish a short or long rest, you automatically cast goodberry without expending a spell slot or material components.

You can cast conjure woodland beings once using a shaman spell slot. You can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast conjure woodland beings once using a shaman spell slot.

description.p: You gain proficiency in the survival skill if you do not already have it, and you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track creatures while in natural environments.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency in the survival skill if you do not already have it, and you have advantage on Survival checks to track creatures while in natural environments.

You can cast ensnaring strike at will as a 1st-level spell, without expending a spell slot or material components.

sheet.description: You can cast ensnaring strike at will as a 1st-level spell, without expending a spell slot or material components.

description.p: You can cast speak with animals at-will, without expending a spell slot. Starting at 5th level, you also can cast speak with plants at-will, without expending a spell slot.

sheet.description: You can cast the speak with animals spell at will.
You can cast the speak with animals and speak with plants spells at will.

You can cast conjure animals once using a shaman spell slot. You can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

Once per turn when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal force damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage. The extra damage is 1d8 for a 1st-level spell slot, plus 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of 5d8.
